articles.title: Free Beer! Budweiser gives Argentina the world cup’s left-over beer free to Argentina fans
articles.description: For its distribution, Budweiser has set up delivery points across the country, forming part of its #BringHomeTheBud campaign. Interested fans need to fill out a form and redeem it at these outlets.
articles.content:
During the Qatar world cup, the sponsor Budweiser said that it will give away all the beer it can’t sell in the stadiums to the eventual World Cup winners.
Budweiser had then tweeted: “New Day, New Tweet. Winning Country gets the Buds. Who will get t... [1325 chars]

articles.content: BAHIA BLANCA (ARGENTINA) – After the party on the field on the lawn of the Iconic Stadium of Lusail and the one in the streets of Buenos Aires, Lautaro Martinez he took the embrace of his people in his native country Bahía Blanca where he was greeted... [1793 chars]

articles.title: ‘Vulgar Clown’, ‘Stupid’: Patrick Vieira and Souness blast Emiliano Martinez, Argentina’s goalkeeper
articles.description: An official complaint was also launched by France against Argentina’s Emiliano Martinez for brutally trolling Kylian Mbappe post the final between Argentina and France.
articles.content: Condemnation keeps coming for the Golden Glove winning Argentine goalkeeper Emiliano ‘Dibu’ Martinez for his reactions after winning the world cup. It was two-pronged: trolling Kylian Mbappe and a lewd gesture just after he received the Golden Glove ... [2076 chars]

articles.title: Conte not happy about quick Premier League restart
articles.description: Out of the 12 Tottenham players who featured in Qatar, Conte has ruled France goalkeeper Hugo Lloris and Argentina's Cristian Romero, who played in the final last Sunday, out of Monday's game.
articles.content:
Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte is “not really happy” that the Premier League will resume just eight days after the World Cup and hinted he might rest players for the Boxing Day match at Brentford.
Out of the 12 Tottenham players who featured... [1325 chars]

articles.title: 'France Stop Crying' - Petition by Argentina Fans Reach More Than 650K Signatures
articles.description: After Argentina's FIFA World Cup win against France, MesOpinions user demanded FIFA to replay France vs Argentina alleging an unfair award of Argentina’s penalty and adding French star Kylian Mbappe was fouled in the lead-up to Di Maria’s goal.
articles.content:

articles.title: Argentine tattooists swamped by demand for Messi tributes
articles.description: Since Argentina's World Cup win turned Buenos Aires into a massive street party, tattoo artists have been hard at work inking the image of Lionel Messi on the bodies of fans paying tribute to the man who has come to rival the legend of the country's other soccer god, Diego Maradona.
articles.content:

articles.title: World Cup final officials hit back at France fans over criticism of Lionel Messi’s extra-time goal
articles.description: The World Cup final officials have hit back at criticism from French fans and sections of the media as the fall-out from Argentina’s victory continues.
articles.content:
T he World Cup final officials have hit back at criticism from French fans and sections of the media as the fall-out from Argentina’s victory continues.
